benchmark_details.name: When LLM Therapists Become Salespeople: Evaluating Large Language Models for Ethical Motivational Interviewing
benchmark_details.overview: This study investigates the ethical awareness of large language models (LLMs) in motivational interviewing (MI) and proposes the Chain-of-Ethic prompt to mitigate unethical practices.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMsâ€™ understanding of ethical motivational interviewing and propose strategies to prevent unethical uses.

data.source: Responses generated by LLMs to motivational interviewing prompts.
data.annotation: Responses were manually annotated as ethical or unethical based on established criteria.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on comparison of LLM responses with human annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better ethical understanding and response generation capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: A weak baseline performance with inaccuracies in ethical detection.
methodology.validation: Experiment conducted on multiple LLMs to assess performance changes after applying proposed Chain-of-Ethic prompt.

harm: Misuse of motivational interviewing techniques for unethical marketing.
